intro: Cochlidium linearifolium, commonly known as the slender leaf bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged in water. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically borne on short stems. It is a carnivorous plant, capable of trapping and digesting small aquatic organisms. Cochlidium linearifolium is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats.
